description.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygiene especially for the most deprived communities, which contributes to Sanitation, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 1: Mother and child survival, growth and development and Programme Component Results (PCR) 2: Protective and learning environment

participating-org.narrative: STATE HEALTH RESOUCE CENTRE CG REGD A C

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
Water - climate resilience and environmental sustainability
Water supply - peri-urban and urban communities service delivery
Water supply - rural communities service delivery
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Government and partners have capacity to scale up improved service delivery at community and facility level sanitation and hygieneespecially for the most deprived communities

description.narrative: UNICEF's technical assistance enabled the National Government, the Ministry of Drinking Water and Sanitation and state governments to restructure the national flagship programme, the National Rural Drinking Water Programme, focusing on sustainability, functionality and water safety aspects with all states initiating operationalisation of water safety plans. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018

title.narrative: Number of states incorporating child centred DRR, CCA and civil strife concerns in flagship programmes
Number of states with monitoring frameworks and guidelines

baseline.value: Currently not all states with fully functional frameworks

target.value: 2016:15% of the 15 targeted states have functional monitoring frameworks

title.narrative: Number of states with a comprehensive and operational water safety cycle approach plan (WSP)

baseline.value: Not all states with fully functional frameworks
